item.title: Counting Deaths
item.description: This day the weekly bills come out To put the people out of doubt How many of the plauge do die; We sume them up most carefully —– Henry Climsell. “London’s Vacation, and the Countries Terme”1 Bill of Morality, 1665. Although morbid, it’s fascinating to read a recent article in the NYT about efforts in Sierra Leone to use “electronic autopsies” in a large scale attempt at counting deaths.
